intro: Dombeya ambalabeensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a rough texture. Dombeya ambalabeensis is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of Madagascar, thriving in well-drained soils.
